title: Level 2 Measurement Practice Test
description: Test your skills with comparing lengths and masses, telling time, and Australian coins!

questions.question: A pencil is 7 paper clips long. A ruler is 12 paper clips long. How much longer is the ruler?
questions.explanation: The difference is $12 - 7 = 5$ paper clips. The ruler is 5 paper clips longer than the pencil.

questions.question: An apple balances with 6 cubes and a pear balances with 10 cubes. Which fruit is heavier?
questions.explanation: The pear balances with 10 cubes while the apple only balances with 6 cubes. Since $10 > 6$, the pear is heavier.

questions.question: When a clock shows half-past 3, where does the minute (long) hand point?
questions.explanation: Half-past means 30 minutes past the hour. The minute hand points to the 6, which represents 30 minutes.

questions.question: The minute hand points to 3 and the hour hand has just passed 8. What time is it?
questions.explanation: When the minute hand points to 3, it's quarter-past (15 minutes past). The hour hand has just passed 8, so the time is quarter-past 8 (8:15).

questions.question: How many cents is one Australian dollar?
Liam has these coins: 50c, 20c, 20c, 10c, 5c. How much money does he have?
A book is 8 hand spans long and a table is 14 hand spans long. How many more hand spans is the table than the book?
questions.explanation: The difference is $14 - 8 = 6$ hand spans. The table is 6 hand spans longer than the book.

questions.question: What time is it when the minute hand points to 6 and the hour hand is between 10 and 11? Write the digital time (e.g. 3:30).
questions.explanation: The minute hand on 6 means half-past (30 minutes). The hour hand between 10 and 11 means the hour is 10. So the time is 10:30 (half-past 10).

questions.question: Add these coins: 20c + 20c + 10c + 5c. How many cents is that?
What time does the clock show when the minute hand points to 9 and the hour hand is nearly at 12? Write the digital time.
questions.explanation: The minute hand on 9 means quarter-to (45 minutes past, or 15 minutes before the next hour). The hour hand is nearly at 12, so the time is quarter-to 12 (11:45).
